title: Myer family along for crash repair ride with AMA
text:
The Myer Family Investments office and the private equity firm run by former Carlyle Group Australian head Simon Moore both took up their full entitlements in the capital raising by crash repair firm AMA Group as it turned into a $900 million entity.

AMA in early October expanded its market share in Australia's $5 billion crash repair industry to around 10 per cent with the $420 million acquisition of Suncorp's Capital SMART crash repair business, increasing its network to 200 outlets in Australasia.

The Myer Family Investments office is betting there will be more bingles on Australian roads. Paul Rovere

The retail component of an entitlement offer to raise $37 million is now underway and scheduled to close on October 21 in the final plank of a broader $216 million capital raising to help pay for the acquisition.

AMA now has 694.1 million shares on issue which at the current share price of $1.28 means AMA has a market capitalisation approaching $900 million. The capital raisings were priced at $1.15 per share.

The Myer Family Office, established in 1925 by Sidney Myer, the founder of the Myer department stores chain, took up its full entitlements in the capital raising, adding to an initial holding of 1.49 per cent which it took up in late 2018 in AMA as part of a different share placement.
description: The Myer family of department store fame and a private equity heavyweight are both betting there will be more bingles on Australian roads.
